text:
For Margot Robbie, it’s not all glitz and glamor. The actress, who played Harley Quinn in the film ‘Suicide Squad,’ just shared what her one regret is for taking on the role of the supervillain character.

In her recent interview with The Hollywood Reporter, Robbie opened up about having stalkers and receiving death threats after starring in the film. Her popularity comes with a price, and it definitely isn’t cheap.

“There’s just all this stuff you learn along the way, like, when you get those death threats, it’s [smart] to have a security team do a background check on whoever sent them to see if there is any past history of violence because you’ll need to know whether you need security to go to certain events,” she told The Hollywood Reporter. “And every time you do a background check, it’s going to cost $2,000, so take that into consideration when you’re getting yourself into this.”

Having said that, Robbie actually regrets not having someone who explained these kinds of things to her before she joined the DC universe.

“I wouldn’t have resented the position I found myself in because I would’ve known what I was getting myself into,” the actress shared.

Despite her one regret, Margot Robbie is still on to polishing her celebrity status, as she recently took on the role of an abused and a disgraced figure skater in the movie ‘I, Tonya.’
